p: Another explanation would be the seasonal difference in outbreak pattern. Seasonal influenza is pandemic in winter (after New Year's Day), whereas it was in spring that pdmH1N1 started to spread in Japan, reaching its peak in late fall. This time period in Japan includes the Golden Week period (4 national holidays in a week at the beginning of May) and the Bon festival (the Buddhist festival of the dead in mid-August), and there is more national travel during these times than during winter.
